Inference: Increasing water usage over successive cycles indicates rising irrigation demand
Description: Upward trends suggest the system requires more water per session, inferred solely from increased cycle volume.
short rationale: Trend shows rising irrigation needs; operational insight with low privacy risk.

Inference: Decreasing water usage across cycles reflects reduced irrigation demand
Description: A downward pattern shows that each new cycle needs less water, meaning irrigation requirements are falling.
short rationale: Falling volumes show lower demand; operational only.

Inference: Constant water usage per cycle indicates stable irrigation requirements
Description: If cycle volumes remain unchanged, watering needs are consistent.
short rationale: Stable volumes reflect steady needs; limited privacy exposure.

Inference: Sudden spikes in water usage suggest unusually high demand for a single cycle
Description: Abrupt increases imply cycles required significantly more water than usual.
short rationale: One-off high demand; operational anomaly, minimal privacy impact.

Inference: Sudden drops in water usage imply short or prematurely terminated cycles
Description: Very small cycle volumes hint at interruptions or abbreviated irrigation sessions.
short rationale: Abbreviated cycles hint interruption; mild operational context.

Inference: Large cycles clustered together indicate periods of heavy irrigation activity
Description: Multiple high-volume cycles suggest sustained high water demand.
short rationale: Heavy-use bursts show demand phases; operational pattern only.

Inference: Small cycles clustered together indicate prolonged light irrigation behavior
Description: Repeated low-volume cycles show a phase of minimal watering requirements.
short rationale: Light-use bursts show low-demand phase; limited privacy signal.

Inference: Highly variable water usage implies inconsistent irrigation performance
Description: Large swings between cycles signal unpredictable watering needs.
short rationale: Volatile volumes reflect performance variability; low privacy risk.

Inference: Low variability across cycles indicates predictable irrigation patterns
Description: Very stable water usage signals consistent irrigation demand.
short rationale: Predictable usage pattern; mild operational exposure.

Inference: Repeated high-usage cycles could indicate over-irrigation tendencies
Description: Regularly exceeding typical cycle volumes suggests excessive watering.
short rationale: Sustained high use reveals watering habit/config; operational behavior exposure.

Inference: Repeated low-usage cycles may signal under-irrigation tendencies
Description: Persistent small volumes imply watering needs are not being met.
short rationale: Persistently low volumes reveal conservative watering habit/config.

Inference: Gradual volume increase over days indicates cumulative water deficit recovery
Description: Cycle volumes rising over time show the system compensating for ongoing dryness.
short rationale: Slow ramp-up shows recovering deficit; operational trend only.

Inference: Gradual volume decrease suggests cumulative water surplus
Description: Cycle volumes reducing over time indicate soil or system holding more water than needed.
short rationale: Slow taper shows surplus; operational trend only.

Inference: Cyclic patterns in usage reflect repeating irrigation rhythms
Description: Recurring volume shapes or intervals imply structured irrigation cycles.
short rationale: Reveals recurring irrigation schedule/rhythm; behavioral pattern exposure.

Inference: Consistently higher water use at similar times of day reveals time-based demand differences
Description: If cycles at certain hours always use more water, irrigation needs follow a daily trend.
short rationale: Time-of-day peaks expose irrigation schedule/behavior.

Inference: Sharp increase in cycle volume at the start of a season suggests updated irrigation needs
Description: Seasonal change prompts large jumps in cycle water consumption.
short rationale: Seasonal adjustment insight; mild operational signal.

Inference: Sharp decrease in cycle volume at the end of a season indicates reduced irrigation needs
Description: Season-ending transitions reduce water consumption per cycle.
short rationale: Seasonal taper; operational trend only.

Inference: Irregular timing of high-cycle water usage suggests reactive irrigation
Description: If high-usage cycles occur unpredictably, irrigation is likely triggered by internal signals.
short rationale: Reactive high-use timing reveals trigger-based behavior.

Inference: Progressive shortening in cycle water use suggests improving soil saturation
Description: Decreasing volume across cycles means the environment requires less water over time.
short rationale: Shorter cycles over time show better saturation; low privacy risk.

Inference: Progressive elongation in cycle water use implies declining soil saturation
Description: Increasing volumes indicate the system is responding to rising irrigation needs.
short rationale: Longer cycles show increasing need; operational only.

Inference: Plateauing at high volumes reflects consistently high irrigation demand
Description: Sustained upper-limit cycle usage points to stable but high water requirements.
short rationale: Sustained high demand; operational signal.

Inference: Plateauing at low volumes reflects consistently low irrigation demand
Description: Stable low usage suggests long-term minimal watering needs.
short rationale: Sustained low demand; operational signal.

Inference: High-frequency micro-cycles indicate short, frequent watering behavior
Description: Numerous very small cycles reflect rapid, low-volume irrigation patterns.
short rationale: Frequent micro-watering exposes detailed irrigation routine.

Inference: Low-frequency macro-cycles indicate long, infrequent watering behavior
Description: Large cycle volumes over few sessions imply infrequent but heavy watering.
short rationale: Infrequent heavy watering reveals routine/preference.

Inference: Inconsistent volumes within the same day indicate dynamic intra-day irrigation needs
Description: Multiple cycles with differing volumes show fluctuating demand across the day.
short rationale: Intra-day variability exposes responsive watering behavior.

Inference: Consistent volumes within the same day suggest rigid irrigation routines
Description: If all cycles in a day use similar volumes, the system follows fixed patterns.
short rationale: Uniform intra-day volumes reveal fixed routine/configuration.

Inference: Anomalously large cycles may signal leak-compensation behavior
Description: Very large cycle volumes may indicate water loss being offset by the system.
short rationale: Potential leak-response behavior exposes maintenance/operational state.

Inference: Anomalously small cycles could indicate clogging or restricted flow
Description: Abnormally low usage suggests poor water delivery or blockages.
short rationale: Suggests clogging/restricted delivery; maintenance/operational exposure.

Inference: Sudden return to normal usage after abnormal cycles suggests transient faults
Description: If anomalies vanish immediately, the event was temporary.
short rationale: Transient fault indicated; mild operational detail.

Inference: Repeated abnormal high or low cycles suggest persistent mechanical issues
Description: Multiple consecutive abnormalities indicate long-term system malfunction.
short rationale: Persistent anomalies reveal ongoing maintenance problems.

Inference: Increasing water usage after a long idle period indicates recharge of depleted conditions
Description: High cycle volumes after inactivity imply long-standing unmet moisture needs.
short rationale: High use after idle hints downtime/absence and recovery behavior.

Inference: Water usage clustering on certain days shows event-driven irrigation behavior
Description: High-usage cycles concentrated on specific days reflect irregular irrigation triggers.
short rationale: Day-specific clusters expose schedule/event-driven watering.

Inference: Water usage symmetry across weeks indicates stable weekly watering requirements
Description: Weekly totals that align show predictable irrigation demand.
short rationale: Stable weekly totals; operational planning insight only.

Inference: Water usage asymmetry across weeks indicates evolving watering needs
Description: Significant weekly shifts reflect changing irrigation requirements.
short rationale: Changing weekly totals; operational trend only.

Inference: High standard deviation in cycle volumes suggests unpredictable irrigation demand
Description: Large variability indicates inconsistent water needs.
short rationale: High variability indicates unstable demand; low privacy risk.

Inference: Low standard deviation in cycle volumes suggests predictable demand
Description: Tight clustering around similar values indicates stability.
short rationale: Low variability shows stable demand; minor operational exposure.

Inference: Multiple cycles with identical volumes reveal fixed-volume irrigation logic
Description: Exact repetition implies the system uses standardized cycle quantities.
short rationale: Exact repeats expose configured fixed-volume control.

Inference: Gradual shift in average cycle volume reveals long-term irrigation trend
Description: Mean cycle volume changing over time shows evolving watering needs.
short rationale: Long-term trend insight; operational only.

Inference: Increasing number of high-use cycles per week indicates escalating demand
Description: More large cycles appearing weekly reflects rising needs.
short rationale: More high-use cycles weekly shows rising need; operational context.

Inference: Decreasing number of high-use cycles per week indicates declining demand
Description: Fewer large cycles show that watering requirements are falling.
short rationale: Fewer high-use cycles weekly shows falling need; operational context.
